abstract: New York State Justice Terence Murphy grants Cory Gloe youthful-offender status and sentences him to six months in jail and five years probation for his role in 2014 street race on Long Island that killed five other teenagers; Gloe, who was 17 years old at time of crash, pleaded guilty to 17-count indictment that included five manslaughter charges.
lead_paragraph: The penalty for Cory Gloe, who was 17 at the time of the crash, came despite revelations that he posted an epithet aimed at the police the day he pleaded guilty.

headline.main: Driver in Long Island Street Race That Killed 5 Gets Jail Sentence
headline.print_headline: Driver in a Long Island Street Race That Killed Five Is Sentenced to Jail

snippet: The penalty for Cory Gloe, who was 17 at the time of the crash, came despite revelations that he posted an epithet aimed at the police the day he pleaded guilty.
